intro: Verbesina phlebodes, commonly known as the showy ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy yellow-orange flower heads. The plant produces composite flowers that consist of both ray and disk florets, typical of the sunflower family. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Verbesina phlebodes thrives in moist, rich soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks.
